p:
The rate of exposure to infection in the community is influenced by age-specific contact rates
12, 20 , the age distribution of infectious contacts
51 , and a proxy for the prevalence of the subtype in the community. The community-driven rate of infection is the rate of exposure modified by the individual’s susceptibility to that subtype,
7

s ( t) is a proxy of influenza activity for subtype s, and

is the fraction of influenza infections attributable to age class cat
n . The parameter β scaled, s scales the flu intensity to determine the per-infectious-contact transmission rate at time t. We calculate L
s ( t) from weekly community surveillance data as (ILI/total general practitioner consultations)(% specimens positive for subtype s) (Fig. 4)
52 . We impose a minimum threshold min( L
s ( t)) = 10 −5.
